Re: License #: CI410409653
Dear Mr. Johnson:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on April
24, 2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action plan is
required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include
the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the corrective
action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be completed
or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
A six-month provisional license is recommended. You must contest or agree to the issuance of a
provisional license in writing, on the CWL-4617 within 15 days, with submission of the corrective
action plan. If you do not submit the CWL-4617, it will be treated as contested. Even if you contest
the issuance of a provisional license, you must still submit an acceptable corrective action plan.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions. In
the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact
the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Shannon (Shay) Mavis
Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CCI Rule 400.4104 Rules compliance
(2) After being licensed, an institution shall, on an
ongoing basis, comply with the act, child caring
institution rules, and terms of the license.
The facility had two special investigations that were initiated in March 2022 that
resulted in a first provisional license being issued in June 2022. The facility
discharged all youth from the facility in March 2022. Since that time the facility has
not had youth or staff, so they have not been able to implement the approved June 8,
2022, corrective action plan to demonstrate their compliance with licensing rules and

were issued a 2nd provisional license in December 2022. The continues to have no
staff or youth, so they have not been able to implement the approved June 8, 2022,
corrective action plan to demonstrate their compliance with licensing rules.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency did not require any Technical Assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• The facility has decided to keep their schooling off-site and is not ending their
lease. Therefore, there will not be any conflicts with the neighboring CCI's
license.
• Discussion of current Corrective Action Plan and future implementation.
• A requirement for searches of youth belongings upon entering the facility to
ensure staff and youth safety.
• Discussion of process for youth referrals, acceptance, and intake.
• Discussion of process to change Chief Administrator from Chris Johnson to
Sarah Gardner in later 2023.
• The necessity for the Chief Administrator to be on-site at the facility to be aware
of day-to-day operations, issues and/or needs.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
The agency submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period. The facility was not able to fully
implement their Corrective Action Plan approved on 12/14/22 as the facility has not
provided services to any children since March 2022. As a result of not accepting
youth referrals, the facility has not been fully staffed during the period of review.
Financial Overview
The facility's financial audit and budget were reviewed. There were no concerns
with their financial information.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable.
Chief Administrator Assessment

Chief Administrator (CA) reported no new staff have been employed or youth
admitted to the facility since the renewal inspection in December 2022. CA noted
all CAP implementations are still pending program re-opening. CA noted once staff
are hired, they will be completing very intensive trainings so staff can feel more
comfortable in knowing procedures, policy and supervision requirements. CA
reported all staff training will be tracked and documented by the training
coordinator to ensure they are keeping on track and up to date. CA also noted
they will be looking more closely at youth information prior to admitting youth into
the program. Required logs and forms will have multiple levels of supervisor
checks to ensure all required material is being completed thoroughly and in a
timely manner.
Staff and Youth Interviews
The only staff employed during the period of review were the Program
Director/Chief Administrator and the Assistant Program Director. Chief
Administrator reported on 4/25/23 the facility was awarded the contract through
ORR, and they were going to begin the hiring process for additional staff
immediately. They anticipate opening their doors and accepting youth within the
next 90 days. They are excited to begin normal operations again. They feel they
are prepared to train staff, so their program is successful and child safety remains
the primary focus.
There are no youth currently placed at the facility.
Description of Agency Walk Through
A walkthrough of the facility was conducted on 4/24/23 and there were no
concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency license be modified to a Third Provisional license.
